==Popularity==
==Popularity==
Linux Mint is one of the most popular Linux distributions. {{As of|2008|10}}, Mint was listed as a major distribution in [[DistroWatch]], replacing [[MEPIS]] in the category of user-friendly distributions.<ref name="DistroWatch Major Release">{{citation |url=http://distrowatch.com/weekly.php?issue=20081006#feature |title=Major distribution updates: Linux Mint and CentOS |last=Bodnar |first=Ladislav |date=6 October 2008 |volume=276 |journal=DistroWatch Weekly |accessdate=22 April 2010}}</ref>
Linux Mint is one of the most popular Linux distributions. {{As of|2008|10}}, Mint was listed as a major distribution in [[DistroWatch]], replacing [[MEPIS]] in the category of user-friendly distributions.<ref name="DistroWatch Major Release">{{citation |url=http://distrowatch.com/weekly.php?issue=20081006#feature |title=Major distribution updates: Linux Mint and CentOS |last=Bodnar |first=Ladislav |date=6 October 2008 |volume=276 |journal=DistroWatch Weekly |accessdate=22 April 2010}}</ref>
â   â
Among [[DistroWatch]] readers, Linux Mint has 3 times more users than competing distributions [[OpenSUSE Project|openSUSE]] and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], 3.8 times more users than [[Mandriva Linux|Mandriva]], yet not quite as many users as [[Ubuntu (Operating system)|Ubuntu]].<ref>http://distrowatch.com/awstats/awstats.DistroWatch.com.osdetail.html</ref>
